definition: demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Do not think that I am a lover of crooked ways.
sentences.chinese: 別以爲我喜歡這些歪門邪道。

sentences.english: Are you aware of your son's falling into evil ways?
sentences.chinese: 您知道您的兒子正在走邪道嗎？

sentences.english: Let's get our minds out of the gutter while discussing this matter.
sentences.chinese: 當討論這件事，我們不可有歪門邪道的念頭。

sentences.english: And will not be able to see the Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 是人行邪道，不能見如來。

sentences.english: Be you aware of your son's falling into evil way?
sentences.chinese: 您知道您的獨生子正在走邪道嗎？

sentences.english: Don't take crooked ways to solve the problem.
sentences.chinese: 不要用歪門邪道解決這個問題。

sentences.english: Or should I call it "Perverts and statues"?
sentences.chinese: 或者可以稱爲“歪門邪道的人和雕像”？

sentences.english: Don't go away, otherwise will go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 不要走邪道，否則會坐牢。
有時廣告也走歪門邪道。

sentences.english: I declined answering Mrs Dean's question, which struck me as something heterodox.
sentences.chinese: 我拒絕回答丁太太的問題，這問題使我覺得有點邪道。

sentences.english: All sorts of crookedness mean death.
sentences.chinese: 所有的邪道意味着死亡。

definition: lit. devil's gate, crooked path (idiom); corrupt practices/crooked methods/dishonesty
Asura, malevolent spirits in Indian mythology
dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
opposition between vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4] and pathogeny 邪氣|邪气[xie2 qi4] (TCM)
lit. true religion/orthodox religion/orthodox Christianity/Islam (in the writing of Chinese or Hui theologians)
